Fuel- and energy-related activities.Fuel: Coal (electricity generation - home produced coal only)

Scope3.Description: Upstream transportation and distribution refer to the emissions generated from the transportation and handling of products, materials, or services purchased by a company. This includes the shipping of raw materials, components, or finished goods from suppliers to the company’s facilities, warehouses, or distribution centers.
Waste generated in operations refers to the emissions resulting from the disposal and treatment of waste produced by a company's day-to-day activities.

Scope3.description: Business travel refers to the emissions generated from employee travel for work purposes, such as flights, car rentals, and hotel stays. Employee commuting refers to the emissions from employees traveling between their homes and the workplace, typically using personal vehicles or public transportation.

Business Travel and Employee Commuting.Product/Service: Air Travel - Medium Haul (>= 300 miles, < 2300 miles)

Scope3.description: Downstream transportation and distribution refer to the emissions generated from the transportation, storage, and distribution of a company’s products after they have been sold.

Scope3.Description: End-of-life treatment of sold products refers to the emissions generated from the disposal, recycling, or treatment of products after they have been used by consumers.
